perturbation.original_text: 7. Salary 7.1 The Executive shall be paid a basic salary of £448,903 per annum subject to deductions required by law. The Executive's salary shall accrue from day to day, shall be payable in equal monthly instalments in arrears on or about the last day of each month.
perturbation.changed_text: 7. Salary 7.1 The Executive shall be paid a basic salary of £448,903 per annum subject to deductions required by law. The Executive's salary shall accrue from day to day, shall be payable in equal monthly instalments in arrears on or about the 15th day of each month.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an in-text contradiction by specifying the salary payment date as the 15th of each month, while the original states 'on or about the last day of each month.' This creates ambiguity regarding the precise payment deadline, leading to potential disputes.

perturbation.original_text: 12. Holidays 12.1 The Executive shall be entitled to 28 days' paid holiday in each holiday year (which includes public holidays) to be taken at times convenient to the Company and authorised in advance. 12.2 The Company's holiday year runs from 1 January to 31 December. If the Executive's employment commences or terminates part way through a holiday year, the Executive's entitlement during that holiday year shall be calculated on a pro rata basis rounded up to the nearest whole day.
perturbation.changed_text: 12. Holidays 12.1 The Executive shall be entitled to 28 days' paid holiday in each holiday year (which includes public holidays) to be taken at times convenient to the Executive and authorized in advance. 12.2 The Company's holiday year runs from 1 January to 31 December. If the Executive's employment commences or terminates part way through a holiday year, the Executive's entitlement during that holiday year shall be calculated on a pro rata basis rounded down to the nearest whole day.
perturbation.explanation: The original contract states that holidays are to be taken at a time that is convenient to the *Company* but the modified clause states that holidays are to be taken at a time that is convenient to the *Executive*. This directly contradicts the original clause. In addition, the original contract states that pro rata holiday is rounded *up* to the nearest day, and the modified clause states it should be rounded *down*.
